intro: Cremanthodium arnicoides, commonly known as the alpine everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the European Alps. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in cold and sunny environments. It produces small, yellowish to white flowers that are often clustered together, and its leaves are narrow and hairy. Cremanthodium arnicoides is known for its resilience to harsh alpine conditions and is often found in meadows and slopes above the tree line.
